llm_outputs.raw_model_response:
Based on the provided text, I could not find any specific information about minimum parking space requirements for the Central Business District (B-1). The document mentions the following regarding parking in the B-1 district:

"Off-street parking and loading requirements. Off-street parking and loading requirements shall be provided for all uses as required by Article H of this chapter."

However, Article H states:

"Off-street parking space shall be provided in accordance with this article in all districts, except the B-1 Central Business District, if adequate public or on-street parking is available within fifty (50) feet of the property. However, if provided in the B-1 District, off-street parking spaces shall be provided at one (1) space per five hundred (500) square feet of gross floor area and comply with the applicable landscaping requirements."

So there is no specific minimum parking requirement for the B-1 district, unless off-street parking is provided, in which case it would be 1 space per 500 sq ft of gross floor area.

Given this, I cannot provide a definitive answer about minimum parking spaces for the Central Business District (B-1). The text suggests parking may not be required at all if adequate public/on-street parking is available nearby.

{
    "extracted_text": null,
    "rationale": "The document does not provide a specific minimum parking requirement for the Central Business District (B-1). It states that off-street parking is not required in B-1 if adequate public/on-street parking is available within 50 feet. If off-street parking is provided in B-1, it should be 1 space per 500 sq ft, but this is not stated as a minimum requirement.",
    "answer": null
}
